result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Trevor John Schoenmann

records.addlTxt:
10:15 AM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Trevor John Schoenmann appeared by phone.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel appeared by video for Trevor John Schoenmann.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney Schoenmenn is heard on the status of the case. Waiting on lab results. 
Attorney Steiner is heard on the timeline of the results.  May as a possible timeframe.
Jury status hearing scheduled for April 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial scheduled for May 16, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury trial on May 16, 2023 at 09:00 am.
Jury status hearing on April 27, 2023 at 09:00 am.

3:02 PM Case called - appearances stated. 
Defendant Trevor John Schoenmann appeared by phone.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel appeared by video for Trevor John Schoenmann.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Angel is heard  - Def. waives reading, stands mute, ask court to enter not guilt pleas
Upon the def. standing mute - Clerk is directed to enter NOT GUILTY plea on all counts
Jury status hearing scheduled for August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Jury status hearing on August 25, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Motion and Demand for Discovery and Inspection

2:56 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Trevor John Schoenmann appeared by phone..  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel appeared by video for Trevor John Schoenmann.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Angel is heard, they are ready to proceed with preliminary hearing. 

1W - Deputy Breeser, sworn
Exam buy Atty Steiner.
Cross by Atty Angel

Court finds probable cause in both cases.
Arraignment scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Petition for Leave to File Additional Motions

02:00 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Defendant Trevor John Schoenmann in court.  Attorney Timothy Luke Angel appeared by video for Trevor John Schoenmann.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
     Court reviews the three counts of the criminal complaint with Def.  Def. states understanding.  
     Atty. Angel states willing to waive 20-day time limit.
     Court concludes at 2:06 p.m.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on June 14, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 001474,
Payable Number: 70826,
Receipt Number: 22R 001535,
Amount: $20.00

Request by Atty Tim Angel to move the 5/23 at 2 PM hearing as he is not available.  JA approved and moved to 5/27 at 2 PM.  Defendant needs to appear in person and Atty Angel is approved to appear by Zoom.

1:41 PM Call to Order by Court.  Appearances stated: Deputy Trevor John Schoemann in court.  Attorney Luke Steiner appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Court finds probable cause. 

State is heard on bond. State requests a signature bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Defendant is heard. 

Court orders a $500.00 signature bond. Defendant is not to possess or consume controlled substances except those specifically prescribed to the defendant. Defendant is to submit to random urinalysis at the request of law enforcement and if results are positive or defendant refuses, defendant shall submit to blood draw. 

Court advises right to an attorney.
Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
